concise_definition: adj. 被猛烈击打的, 被彻底击败的; v. (过去式/过去分词) 敲打, 猛烈攻击, 反复强调; adv. (非正式) 醉得厉害的

definitions.explanation_en: To strike something repeatedly with a hammer or other heavy object, often with force or violence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用锤子或其他重物反复猛烈击打某物，通常带有力量或暴力性。
definitions.example_en: The carpenter hammered the nails into the wooden frame.
definitions.example_cn: 木匠把钉子敲进了木框架里。

definitions.explanation_en: To attack or criticize someone or something relentlessly, often in speech or writing.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以持续不断的方式攻击或批评某人或某事，常用于言语或文字中。
definitions.example_en: The opposition party hammered the government for its handling of the economy.
definitions.example_cn: 反对党猛烈抨击政府对经济的管理不善。

definitions.explanation_en: To emphasize or repeat something persistently, often to make a point or drive home an idea.
definitions.explanation_cn: 反复强调或重复某事，通常是为了阐明观点或加深印象。
definitions.example_en: The teacher hammered home the importance of studying regularly.
definitions.example_cn: 老师反复强调了定期学习的重要性。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that has been severely damaged, defeated, or overwhelmed, often by force or pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某物被严重损坏、彻底击败或压垮，通常因外力或压力所致。
definitions.example_en: After the storm, the coastal town was hammered by flooding.
definitions.example_cn: 风暴过后，沿海小镇被洪水彻底摧毁。

definitions.explanation_en: (Informal) Extremely drunk or intoxicated, often to the point of being incapacitated.
definitions.explanation_cn: (非正式) 醉得非常厉害，通常达到无法行动的程度。
definitions.example_en: He was hammered after drinking six beers at the party.
definitions.example_cn: 他在聚会上喝了六瓶啤酒，醉得不省人事。

comparison.analysis: “Beat” (击打/击败) 更泛指任何形式的打击或战胜，可以是物理的、比赛的或心理的，语气较轻或中性。而 “hammered” 强调反复、猛烈、持续的打击，带有更强的破坏性和情绪强度。
“Criticize” (批评) 是中性或正式的词汇，指指出缺点或错误，不一定带有情绪。而 “hammered” 作为动词使用时，带有强烈的情感色彩，暗示攻击性、持续性和压倒性的批评，语气更激烈。
“Drunk” (喝醉的) 是描述醉酒状态的标准中性词，可作形容词或名词。而 “hammered” 是非正式俚语，语气更强烈、口语化，常用于年轻人或非正式语境，暗示醉酒程度极深，甚至失去控制。
